page.title: 05Landscape - Vegetation
page.content: The higher rockier ground has tended to lose both plant and soil cover as the gulls have advanced, but the thicker peaty soil, heavily manured by gulls, has resulted in a lush summer growth of orache, chickweed and curled dock. However during the winter the soil is vulnerable to erosion by wintering gull roosts, puffin nesting burrows and rabbit warrens as well as by the forces of wind and rain. The lichen growth is lush and a variety of different types. There is a certain amount of air pollution from the mainland and from vessels in the Forth and leafy lichens have not been observed.
